title: Ticket #3025: Autodetect proxy-location
description:
If a user wants their x509 proxy available in the vanilla universe job environment, it usually involves some level of black magic in the submit file, such as:

x509userproxy = /tmp/x509up_u1221

Since the proxy location varies from user to user, this is pretty effective in stopping folks from sharing submit scripts. Alternately, it is miserable for the sysadmin to get this to be added to the job automatically (we have to hack up a combination of profile.d and SUBMIT_EXPRS).

I propose that we do the normal proxy location resolving mechanisms for vanilla uni jobs if the following is set:

transfer_x509userproxy = True

This would greatly simplify the task of auto-inserting this into submit files.
remarks:
2012-Sep-11 10:59:33 by smoler:
Documentation needs tweaking.

For the submit command use_x509userproxy,

  • default is False, unless grid universe of specific grid types?
  • list of grid types where this submit command is ignored/irrelevant (and forced to True) is gt2, gt5, cream, and nordugrid?

For the submit command x509userproxy,

  • should the list of grid types where the command is relevant also include cream?

2012-Sep-14 11:04:03 by jfrey:
Documentation tweaks:

use_x509userproxy:

  • Default is False.
  • Value is forced to True if the job is a gt2, gt5, nordugrid, or cream grid job, or if x509userproxy is present in the submit file.
  • Setting to False when the default is forced to True has no effect.

x509userproxy:

  • Grid-types cream and condor should be added to the list of relevant types.
